level.text: Wherever there is reason to believe that a drug-, firearm-, or prostitution-related nuisance exists, the United States Attorney for the District of Columbia, the Corporation Counsel for the District of Columbia, or any community-based organization may file an action in the Superior Court of the District of Columbia to abate, enjoin, and prevent the drug-, firearm-, or prostitution-related nuisance.

Such actions shall be commenced by the filing of a complaint in the Civil Branch of the Superior Court of the District of Columbia against any person alleging the facts constituting the drug-, firearm-, or prostitution-related nuisance.
Such actions shall be in equity and shall be tried without a jury.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-81 substituted "drug or prostitution-related" for "drug-related".
D.C. Law 18-259 substituted "drug-, firearm-, or prostitution-related" for "drug or prostitution-related".
